parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A price, honor. From tino; a value, i.e. Money paid, or valuables; by analogy, esteem, or the dignity itself.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: To be unfaithful, disbelieve, refuse belief, prove false. From apistos; to be unbelieving, i.e. disbelieve, or disobey.
A stone; met: of Jesus as the chief stone in a building. Apparently a primary word; a stone.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From the same as oikodome; to be a house-builder, i.e. Construct or confirm.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To reject after testing (examination), disqualify. From apo and dokimazo; to disapprove, i.e. to repudiate.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
A corner; met: a secret place. Probably akin to gonu; an angle.
